item.title: Go Daily Question 029
item.author: loommii
item.description:
Which of the following assignments is correct?

A. var x = nil B. var x interface{} = nil C. var x string = nil D. var x error = nil

BD. This question tests the knowledge of nil. nil can only be assigned to pointers.

A: Type not specified. B: Empty interface can be assigned nil. C: A string is essentially a read-only slice and cannot be assigned nil. D: error is essentially an interface type and can be assigned nil.
